hi
thank you for your membership...a friend from another forum 
recommended me here to further my research for a tsuba i have 
aquired.a brief story and pictures and measurements will follow as 
soon as i know how to post them.was told and have written proof via a 
simple letter that this tsuba was given to the head of a refrectory 
in 1920 by 2 japanese goverment officials over here in the uk on a 
goverment survey on our penal/poor law/social law and this tsuba was 
given as thank you gift,it has never been mounted and in exeptionel 
condition.it has been seen by roy bottomley of the royal armouries in 
leeds who passed in on to a more knowledgable chap from a well known 
sword society called steve smith.his opinion is a nara or more likely 
aizu shoami tsuba of around 1850...1890.if the later then its the 
more quality piece has its well thought out and the quality of the ji 
is so good,surmie kashiga of japan has also given more or less the 
same opinion stating that the quality is very good,,,,,any 
information that you can give me would be warmly welcomed....more 
info can be posted so please ask what ever you require.....once again 
thank you
